channel.title: Working on a Java Disassembler
channel.description:
Let me start with saying: yes, I know we have [url=http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javap.html]javap[/url] for this.
I wanted to do something about my lack of knowledge of concepts such as decompiling, disassembling, bytecode, etc. That's why I started off by making a simple HEX viewer which allowed me to browse the HEX of Java Class files.
As it seems rather intriguing to be able to at least read bytecode, I started reading small parts of [url=https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jvms/se7/html/jvms-4.html#jvms-4.7-300]this document[/url], which provided me with the necessary insight to start building my own Java Disassembler.
I have been working on it for a solid three to four hours (whilst continuously learning) and came up with a basic version able to read the.. .. Class file's magic number (0xCAFEBABE) .. Major + Minor version .. Constant Pool Count .. Constant Pool .. Access Flags .. Class' and super class' names .. Interface Count .. Implemented interface's names .. Fields count .. Fields: access flags, name index, descriptor index and attributes count .. Fields' attributes: attribute name index, attribute length and info for attribute
Example: [url=http://pastebin.com/iniHde7N]Input Java files[/url] [url=http://pastebin.com/FFQByLJY]Output[/url]
Next up I will be working on getting the methods!

item.title: Working on a Java Disassembler
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

read the whitepaper on the class file format. it took me half a week a eons ago iirc. also, why bother? there’s javap

item.title: Working on a Java Disassembler
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:2, topic:554329”]Why do you care about your lack of knowledge about decompiling, disassembling, bytecode etc?
I’m sure you’ve learnt something, but not as sure about what you’ve learnt is useful.[/quote]

To be honest I just like learning about this kind of stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Working on a Java Disassembler
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

Let me start with saying: yes, I know we have javap for this.

I wanted to do something about my lack of knowledge of concepts such as decompiling, disassembling, bytecode, etc. That’s why I started off by making a simple HEX viewer which allowed me to browse the HEX of Java Class files.

As it seems rather intriguing to be able to at least read bytecode, I started reading small parts of this document, which provided me with the necessary insight to start building my own Java Disassembler.

I have been working on it for a solid three to four hours (whilst continuously learning) and came up with a basic version able to read the…
… Class file’s magic number (0xCAFEBABE)
… Major + Minor version
… Constant Pool Count
… Constant Pool
… Access Flags
… Class’ and super class’ names
… Interface Count
… Implemented interface’s names
… Fields count
… Fields: access flags, name index, descriptor index and attributes count
… Fields’ attributes: attribute name index, attribute length and info for attribute

Example:
Input Java files
Output

Next up I will be working on getting the methods!

Read full topic
